children.name: moving slowly or doing sth slowly
slow-moving u
children.definition: slow-moving moving slowly, especially because of being prevented from moving faster:đi chậm, di chuyển chậm
examples: ▪ in the evenings the roads out of town are clogged with slow-moving traffic.
▪ lubbers are slow-moving flightless insects native to the southeastern u.s.
▪ the canal’s water was muddy and slow-moving.

children.name: leisurely x
children.definition: leisurely moving or doing sth slowly, especially because you are enjoying what you are doing and do not have to hurry:một cách nhàn nhã, ung dung
examples: ▪ sunday mornings she gets up late and then has a leisurely breakfast with her family.
▪ we spent a leisurely afternoon talking about old times.
at a leisurely pace
▪ the two set off walking down the beach at a leisurely pace.

children.name: at low speed b1
children.definition: at low speed if a vehicle travels at low speed, it moves more slowly than it usually does:tốc độ chậm
examples: you’ll save money on petrol if you drive your car at low speed.
the car came towards them at low speed, and then someone leaned out the back window and started shooting.
low-speed[attri]
low-speed crashes can still prove deadly, especially to children.

children.name: at a snail’s pace x
children.definition: at a snail’s pace moving or doing something extremely slowly, especially when this is annoying:chậm như sên
examples: ▪ traffic was moving at a snail’s pace.
▪ the development project seems to be moving at a snail’s pace.

children.name: slow a1
children.definition: slow not moving quickly or not doing something quickly:chậm
examples: ▪ the train was slow, noisy, and uncomfortable.
▪ i was always one of the slowest runners in my class.
▪ my computer’s really slow compared to the ones at school.
slow to do sth
▪ farmers in the region have been slow to adopt modern agricultural methods.
slow in doing sth
▪ the cia has been slow in turning over the documents that congress requested.
slowly[adv] a2
▪ he got up slowly out of his chair and came towards me.
▪ can you speak more slowly? i can’t understand what you’re saying.
▪ large white clouds drifted slowly across the deep blue sky.
▪ lynne slowly began to realize the job wasn’t as easy as it seemed.

children.name: sluggish x
children.definition: sluggish moving more slowly than usual, especially because of a loss of power or energy:chậm chạp, lười biếng
examples: ▪ the car felt sluggish as we drove up the hill.
▪ the children were tired and sluggish and didn’t seem interested in any of the games.
sluggishly[adv]
▪ ‘i should probably go,’ mike said, rising sluggishly from the sofa.

children.name: slowcoach x
children.definition: slowcoachbritish /slowpokeus  spoken someone who does something too slowly, works too slowly, walks too slowly, etc:người chậm chập
examples: come on, slowcoach! if you don’t hurry up, we’ll be late.
i hate getting stuck behind these slowpokes on the highway.

children.name: at high speed b1
children.definition: at high speedmovingorworkingvery fast - use this aboutcars,trains,machinesetc :với tốc độ cao
examples: two cars raced past him at high speed.
a metal disk revolving at high speed

children.name: at top speed x
children.definition: at top speed if avehiclemoves at top speed, it moves as fast as it can go - use this especially when a situation isurgentand sb has to get somewhere very fast:với tốc độ cao nhất
examples: they headed east at top speed in pursuit of the enemy ship.
at top speed, the pave hawk helicopter can travel 221 miles per hour.
the train thundered through the station at top speed.

children.name: swift c2
children.definition: swiftwrittenmovingfast with a continuous, flowing movement - used especially inliterature:mau, nhanh, lẹ
examples: the horses ran along the track at a swift trot.
we had to steer our ship through the swift currents of the bering straits.
swiftly[adv]c2
walking swiftly, he was at the station within minutes.
white clumps of cloud were moving swiftly across the sky.
swiftness[u]
these animals are unrivalled for their grace and swiftness.

children.name: at breakneck speed x
children.definition: at breakneck speed travellingdangerouslyfast:ở tốc độ chóng mặt
examples: it took us an hour to get there, driving at breakneck speed.
jenny stepped onto her skis and sped off at breakneck speed down the glistening, white mountain.
they were cycling alongatbreakneckspeed/at abreakneckpace.

children.name: flat out x
children.definition: flat out at thefastestspeed possible when using all the strength or power there is : hết tốc lực
examples: going flat out, the bmw 325 will reach a speed of 140 miles per hour.
the exercise involved running flat out for two minutes and then resting for one minute.

children.name: like lightning x
children.definition: like lightningmovingextremely fast, often with asinglesuddenmovement:nhanh như chớp
examples: somewhere a dog barked and, like lightning, the cat darted into some bushes.
her foot slipped on the smooth tiles but mitch moved like lightning and caught her before she fell.

children.name: at speed b2
children.definition: at speed formal if a car or train is travelling at speed, it is travelling fast: nhanh
examples: the train was already travelling at speed when she tried to open the carriage door.

children.name: fast a2
children.definition: fast/fɑːstǁfæst/  nhanh
examples: ▪ don’t drive so fast - there’s ice on the road.
▪ the new fighter aircraft flies almost twice as fast as the old one.
▪ she walked faster and faster, then started to run.
as fast as you can
▪ he ran home as fast as he could.

children.name: quick x
children.definition: quickspokenuse this to tell sb to come or go somewhere quickly :
examples: come quick, your brother’s on tv.
you’ll have to walk quicker than that if you want to keep up with me.

children.name: slow a1
children.definition: slow/sləʊ/  chậm
examples: ▪ she’s making a slow recovery after her illness.
▪ rebuilding the country’s economy is likely to be a long, slow process.
▪ for the first few months that i was taking lessons, my progress was extremely slow.
slowly/ˈsləʊli/ [adverb] a2
▪ the situation is slowly improving.
▪ slowly prices began to fall.
▪ their relationship has developed slowly, but they now consider each other close friends.

children.name: gradual b2
children.definition: gradual/ˈgrædʒuəl/  happening, developing, or changing slowly over a long period of time:từ từ, dần dần
examples: ▪ i had noticed a gradual improvement in her written work.
▪ the chart showed a gradual rise in his temperature over the previous eight hours.
▪ because the cell destruction is gradual, a victim’s pancreas can function normally for years.
gradually[adv] b2 slowly over a period of time
▪ the climate is gradually becoming drier and warmer.
▪ as the weeks passed, i gradually accepted the idea of him leaving.
▪ most patients gradually develop a resistance to the drug.

children.name: little by little b2
children.definition: little by little/bit by bitc1  happening or done slowly in a series of small amounts or stages - use this especially about something that is gradually improving: từng chút một
examples: ▪ little by little, greg’s health improved.
▪ bit by bit, the dogs got used to their new surroundings.
▪ then add the olive oil, little by little, beating continuously until the sauce thickens.

children.name: slowly but surely x
children.definition: slowly but surely if something, especially an improvement in something, happens slowly but surely, it happens slowly and steadily until it is completed: chậm mà chắc
examples: ▪ slowly but surely, the company is becoming successful again.
▪ she’s getting better, slowly but surely.

children.name: by degrees x
children.definition: by degrees/baɪ dɪˈgriːz/  happening, developing, or changing very slowly, through a series of small changes that may be difficult to notice: dần dần
examples: ▪ by degrees, little children grow less dependent on their parents.
▪ the storm intensified by degrees until the rain was pouring down.

children.name: fast a1
children.definition: fast/fɑːstǁfæst/
examples: ▪ dean always loved fast cars and expensive clothes.
▪ rosa caught the fast train to london.
▪ boeing’s new plane is faster and more luxurious than anything else they have ever produced.

children.name: high-speed x
children.definition: high-speed
examples: high-speed train/computer/drill etca train, computer etc that moves or operates very fast: tốc độ cao
the era of high-speed jet travel began after the end of world war ii.
journey times have been reduced considerably since the introduction of high-speed trains.
you can travel by high-speed train from paris to brussels.
a high-speed drill

children.name: supersonic x
children.definition: supersonicsupersonic aircraft/travel/flight etcfaster than the speed of sound: siêu tốc, siêu âm thanh
examples: concorde is capable of travelling at supersonic speeds.
thanks to supersonic travel, busy executives can attend meetings in new york and be back in london the same day.
a supersonic fighter plane

children.name: fast a1
children.definition: fast able to go fast::nhanh
examples: ▪ when i was a kid, i was the fastest boy in my class.
khi còn là một cậu bé, tôi là đứa nhanh nhất trong lớp.
fastadjectivequicknhanh;mau
moving or happening quickly, or able to move or happen quickly
_fast cars
_a fast swimmer
_computers are getting faster all the time.
_the fast train (= one that stops at fewer stations and travels quickly) to london takes less than an hour.

children.name: doing things quickly or happening quickly
quickly a2
children.definition: quickly doing thingsquicklyor happeningquickly, without taking much time :
examples: she undressed quickly and got into bed.
it’s important to realize how quickly this disease can spread.
quickly fry the onions, then add the meat.
we need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
kids grow up so quickly these days.
registerin everyday english, people usually use a verb such asrush,run, orhurryrather than saygo quickly:
shewent quicklyto fetch the doctor.➔sheranto fetch the doctor.

children.name: quick a2
children.definition: quick aquickmovement or action is one that you do quickly or one that only takes a short time :
examples: i’ll just take a quick shower.
that was quick -- have you finished already?
i had to make a quick decision.
be quickuse this when you are telling someone to hurry
you’ll have to be quick - we don’t have much time.

children.name: fast a2
children.definition: fast if you work, talk, or writefast, you do it quickly :
examples: don’t talk so fast - i can’t understand what you’re saying.
we’re working as fast as we can.

children.name: rapid b2
children.definition: rapid arapidchange, increase, or improvement is one that happens much more quickly than usual :
examples: a rapid increase in the population
she made a rapid recovery after her operation.
adolescence is a period of great and rapid change.
rapidly[adv]
the rapidly changing world of computer technology

children.name: swift c2
children.definition: swift happening or done very quickly and without any delay :
examples: punishment of the protesters was swift and severe.
swift fashion changes mean that the shop has to change its stock every six to eight weeks.

children.name: speedy x
children.definition: speedy aspeedyreturn, reply, reaction, etc is one that is done or made successfully, as quickly and efficiently as possible :
examples: we are working to ensure the safe and speedy return of all the refugees to their homes.
thousands of letters and telegrams arrived wishing nikolai a speedy recovery from his surgery.
speedily[adv]
the mayor’s proposal was speedily approved by the town council.

children.name: prompt b2
children.definition: prompt apromptaction, reply, delivery etc is one that is done without delay because quick action is needed : nhanh chóng, mau lẹ
examples: a major disaster was prevented by the prompt action of the safety officer.
it is important to ensure prompt delivery of goods that customers order.
promptly[adv] b2
store the shellfish in a covered container and refrigerate them promptly.

children.name: meteotic x
children.definition: meteoric
examples: meteoric rise/careerachieving success extremely quickly and suddenly :
the film tells the story of lee’s meteoric rise from north dakota radio singer to jazz legend.

children.name: at an alarming rate b2
children.definition: at an alarming rate if sth happensat an alarming rate, it happens so quickly that it makes people very worried :
examples: the amazonian rainforest is disappearing at an alarming rate.
the number of people dying from lung cancer has increased at an alarming rate.

children.name: in a flash c2
children.definition: in a flash use this to say that something happens extremely quickly and suddenly, so that you almost do not notice what is happening : trong nháy mắt
examples: he was gone in a flash.
in a flash atticus was up and standing over him.
joel slipped but was on his feet in a flash.
